DataElement.preferredName: Patient Congenital Abnormality Long QT Interval Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the elements of a patient's medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial that is an abnormality of long time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Congenital Abnormality Long QT Interval Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the elements of a patient's medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial that is an abnormality of long time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Congenital Abnormality Long QT Interval Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.:Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.:Time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.:Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormality, anatomical or biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period.
Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.
The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle.
Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Congenital long QT syndrome or QTcF>450 msec on screening ECG:
- Complete left bundle block or use of a permanent cardiac pacemaker, history or presence of ventricular tachyarrhythmias, clinically significant resting bradycardia (<50 beats per minute)
- Right bundle branch block + left anterior hemiblock (bifascicular block

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of congenital prolonged QT syndrome

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a resting ECG with QTc > 470 msec detected on 2 or more time points within a 24 hour period or family history of long QT syndrome

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have congenital prolonged QT syndrome or bradyarrythmias

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congenital prolonged QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a pre-existing diagnosis of a prolonged QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of long QT Syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an intraventricular conduction delay (QRS interval > 120 msec)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a resting ECG with QTc greater than 470 msec detected on 2 or more time points within a 24 hour period or family history of long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congenital long QT syndrome or congenital heart block?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of congenital prolonged QT syndrome, congestive heart failure or uncontrolled arrhythmia in the past 6 months prior to study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have QTc over 450msec that does not correct with correction of electrolyte abnormalities or family history of long QT syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known congenital long QT syndrome or screening QT interval corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) greater than 470 milliseconds?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have congenital long QT syndrome, family history of long QT syndrome, QTc using Fridericiaâ€™s formula (QTcF) interval greater than 470 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have congenital long QT syndrome, family history of long QT syndrome, QTc using Fridericias formula (QTcF) interval greater than 470 ms?
